tit.j: エルトゥールル号遭難事件
tit.e: The distress of Frigate Ertuğrul Fırkateyni
The distress of Frigate Ertuğrul Fırkateyni

sen.j: エルトゥールル号遭難事件（エルトゥールルごうそうなんじけん）とは、1890年（明治23年）9月16日夜半、オスマン帝国（現在のトルコ）の軍艦エルトゥールル号（Ertuğrul Fırkateyni）が、和歌山県串本町沖、紀伊大島の樫野埼灯台東方海上で遭難した事件。
sen.e: The distress of Ertuğrul was a disaster that Ertuğrul, a sailing frigate of the Ottoman Navy met, off the east coast of Kashinozaki Lighthouse in Kii-Oshima Island, Kushimoto-cho Town, Wakayama prefecture, in the midnight of September 16, 1890.

The distress of Frigate Ertuğrul was a shipwreck that Ertuğrul, a sailing frigate of the Ottoman Navy, suffered off the east of Kashinozaki Lighthouse in Kii-Oshima Island, Kushimoto-cho Town, Wakayama prefecture, on the middle of the night of September 16, 1890.
sen.cmt: commaの位置を直し、若干語を変えました。

sen.j: 木造フリゲート艦エルトゥールル号（1864年建造、全長76m）は、1887年に行われた日本の皇族、小松宮彰仁親王夫妻のイスタンブル訪問に応えることを目的に、訓練不足のオスマン帝国海軍の練習航海を兼ねて日本へ派遣されることとなった。
sen.e: To respond to Istanbul visit of 1887 by Imperial Prince and Princess Komatsunomiya Akihito, the Imperial family of Japan, Ertuğrul, the wooden frigate (built in 1864, total length, 76m) was dispatched to Japan, also with a aim of training voyage of the the Ottoman Empire Navy, which had not been well-trained.

In order to respond to the visit of the Imperial Prince Komatsunomiya Akihito and Princess from the Imperial family of Japan in 1887, the dispatch of the Ertuğrul, a wooden frigate (built in 1864 with its total length of 76m), to Japan was decided, also aiming to make a training voyage of the the Ottoman Empire Navy which lacked enough training.

In response to the visit to Istanbul by Imperial Prince Komatsunomiya Akihito and his wife from the Imperial family of Japan in 1887, it was decided that the Ertuğrul, a wooden frigate (built in 1864 with a total length of 76 m) would be dispatched, to Japan; this would also serve as a training voyage for the Ottoman Empire Navy, which lacked sufficient training at that time.

sen.j: 数々の困難に遭いながらも、航海の途上に立ち寄ったイスラム教国で熱烈な歓迎を受けつつ、11ヶ月をかけて翌1890年6月ようやく日本に到着した。

sen.j: この点についてのNHKへの問い合わせに対して、NHK側は、「1985年の救出に直接関わったトルコ大使やトルコ航空機長など当事者の方々に確認したところ、エルトゥールル号事件のことは全くご存知ありませんでした。
sen.e: In response to inquiries to NHK about this issue, 'We asked people who had been concerned with the rescue operation in 1985 such as a Turkish ambassador and a Turkish Airlines captain, however nobody knew about the Ertuğrul incident.

sen.e: In January and February, 2008, Turkish staff members of the Institute of Nautical Archaeology of the United States, carried out underwater excavation and salvaged over 1000 remains, bullets and other articles.
